comments.body: This is a good idea
I love it! It would be like a siren, making it harder for players to get out of water. Maybe if the players wore a carved pumpkin, the effects would be neglected!
Sounds great! glow squid never looked harmless. And the fact they can literally HYPNOTIZE you is something no one in this WORLD could think about
Y. E. S.

‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt be worth fighting‚Äù they said they don‚Äôt want players to want to fight it. It could drop something, but it should be something you only need one of, if it drops a weapon then people will want to kill it again to get another one when their‚Äôs breaks or something. A trophy item, like kingbdogz said in the ask mojang episode would be good, something to show ‚ÄúI killed the warden‚Äù without you wanting to keep going back and get more. But I‚Äôd also be fine with it not dropping anything.
You're not supposed to fight it, you're supposed to run away from it

You definitely aren't supposed to fight it, and it's not supposed to be worth fighting. However, it would be good to have a trophy item for those players who will fight it anyway, like a warden head that doesn't do anything, but looks awesome, and can be worn or placed like a block.

Maybe it would give you blindness when wearing it?
It is supposed to be a force of nature and a reason to stay away from the new deep dark biome, DO NOT try to kill it even if it drops a trophy
i like the idea of the warden dropping a new weapon
If you don't like the warden don't go to the deep dark.
The Warden should be something you fight and get a reward for. Kind of like how evokers drop totems of undying.

I feel the point of the Warden is to be a monster so strong you shouldn't try to kill it and instead avoid it, although I do agree with your last point there- there should be a trophy or cosmetic item for bragging rights.
I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs time to say that the mob "should drop anything." because it was not yet in the snapshots. for sure the developers have plans for Warden`s drop

They have no plans for a specific reason, Mojang wants warden to be something you run from not face. I do not think it should drop something however you do have a point. Maybe you do not need to kill it but maybe there should be really good loot in the deep dark so players still try to run from the warden but get into at least small fights with it to get loot.

The devs don‚Äôt want the warden to be a boss or thing you show off by defeating it.the warden is a mob that was intentionally designed to scare and make you run the warden is to prove that even if you get everything that you are not invincible. There may be a trophy or decimal drop like the dragon egg but most likely it will have no use but for being a trophy. It is very unlikely for it to end up dropping a weapon since it was intended for it to be avoided. I think it would be very cool for it to have a drop like a trophy maybe. I‚Äôm exited to see how the warden comes out in the snapshots.
It's SUPPOSED to not be worth fighting, that's the whole point smh

What about giving the expression *I'm out for blood" a new in-game meaning? Maybe we go deep in the caves for some bottles of Warden's blood, like literally. Each time we hit him with a sword or axe he starts to bleed, then we have to hit him with a empty bottle to collect his blood. The wound would be open only for a short while, then heals up and we'd have to hit him again, until eventually killing him. His blood could be some shade of blue or green and could be the base ingredient for a whole new line of potions or at least a new one that gives us both strength and resistance II and could be increased to level III or extended in time. That means an eight minutes potion of strength II and resistance II at the same time. Or both for short time but a level III.

But this next one I believe it's far better. Mob spawners are nothing but cages, right? Warden are supposed to have the authority to lock people up but also set them free (I know, not exactly like that, but still, the basic). So what about the Warden drops a key to "open" and move mob spawners, or the itens to make them like special iron bars, enchanted ones.
I think I'm gonna suggest that myself.

Warden should not drop anything because its supposed to scare players. Maybe if it does drop something it gives you a curse that maybe could give you blindness in caves and summons a bunch of monsters too. You can not get rid of it unless you drink milk but it has three waves tat come randomly.

If thats not the case I do not know, maybe you have a better idea here. Just a suggestion.
In my opinion players have too much control and the warden is limiting it. It gives the player a challenge. That way players have to be even more cautious in caves like the deep dark.
The sculk stuff spawn with warden am i right? If you have one of them then that means you are strong to fight with the warden right?
But maybe something like "The heart of warden" would fit in perfectly. And maybe you can brew blindness potions with it.

People, please we all know that even though the warden will be a hostile to avoid and not to kill many (including myself) we will kill him, there are literally so many very easy ways to kill him; They are for example: get up to a very high place where he cannot reach you and throw stalactites or arrows at him, putting lava or locking himself in a block of 2 high (where the warden could not enter since he is more than 3 high)
The only thing that I say is that hopefully they give him the ability to tear blocks, be immune to drowning and lava and that he is capable of climbing (if so I admit it, he will be the most dangerous creature in Minecraft after wither)
Dude it‚Äôs meant to be an obstacle of the deep dark. It‚Äôs meant to guard the chests that has loot.

Yeah, while the warden is meant as a sort of boundary between player and The Deep Dark, if you had to kill it to survive, do you not deserve something for killing it? I thought of The Warden's Head, just as a decoration. The drop from a warden, however, could be anything from raw beef to an advanced device useful for security. We shall see.
From what I've heard the Warden will guard loot. He will not drop it. He could drop a trophy item though. The reason he's so powerful is because he's not supposed to be messed with.

The Warden should not drop anything, not even a trophy item, as almost anything would be an incentive to fight it unless it is something useless. Like rotten flesh, or diorite. And personally, I would rather get nothing than a useless item that clutters my inventory. Good thing we have bundles for that now

I don't think there will ever be a situation where you have to kill the Warden to survive. They would most likely always be easier to escape from than to fight, as they can kill you in 2 hits with full netherite armor
So there would never be a "Oh, it's attacking me, better dispose of it real quick." There's no disposing of it "real quick," unless it is the Warden disposing of you

Maybe a scythe, and they could make it so that only the first oen to load into the world/ generate can hold it, and that will be the only chance you ever get, so if you run away from it and it despawns, then you Can't get that scythe again. Unless there could possibly be a warden dungeon and in the chest there could be the scythe? But there is only one dungeon in the minecraft world
yeah it would be kinda disappointing if you kill it and get nothing i was thinking that it would drop a warden ear that can be used to craft the skulk sensor
A tiny trophy item would be nice
Anybody who thinks warden is useless just play in snapshot 21w08a because it does not have warden.

He could protect or drop the experience totem.

When the player dies, the experience totem in the player's hand is sacrificed so that the player's experience points remain with him at the next spawn. In short, experience points do not change with the player's death.
maybe it could drop a item that could be combined with weapons and armor (the same way netherite works)  and give the item a cool enchantment.

The warden is not supposed to be fought, he should be avoided. I still agree that something should be dropped if killed tho, but I'd refrain from items or recourses, maybe a giant amount of xp rivaling the ender dragon would be nice. This would make it a short but risky way to lvl up.
your not supposed to kill it, first off. and cant it just drop like, a warden head that is like the ender dragon egg.  something that only says, i did it
The sculk catalyst is the drop from the warden.
That'll make The Cave and Cliffs update much betterüòÄ and I like the Idea of adding a new Zombie variant
Thank you.
Yeah, this would be nice addition to the current update. What would be nice is taking the Frozen Zombie variant from Minecraft Dungeons.
I agree.  Minecraftt dungeons has sooo many cool mobs and to barrow a couple wouldn't hurt right?
Beautiful Idea
Hey guys, if you have an idea that could match with this new biome, share it here please :D It would be grateful. Bye !

Nice! I like the thought of maple trees, and I think syrup would open up a lot of crafting recipes with food! I also had the random thought that you could place it on a cake. Not to make a pancake or anything. Just to put syrup on a cake. I don't know why I thought of that.

I thought an idea to have saplings of all autumn leaves on existing trees to and a couple of other autumn biome variants, which is in this other feedback post:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077144012/comments/360014372212
Oooo and red leaves with a maple tree and dead leaf piles and even a rake to collect it.
Maybe some pumpkin patches around this forest would look nice
Great idea! If this gets added it should have a leaf patch mechanic similar to the ones in the Cherry Grove biome and some cute animals like squirrels that can climb the trees and foxes there!

i wish they really added this. the cherry blossom/cherry grove biome really reignited my desire for this. autumn is such a beautiful time of the year and honestly having an autumn biome would remove the need for seasons bc it's the only season not really represented in the game.

much like the azalea trees you wouldn't even need new wood. in the autumn biome, oak trees become maple (tall oak trees with redish leaves) and the birch trees become silver birch (tall birch trees with yellow leaves). and maybe put in a ginkgo tree if possible. and just like we have the new cherry blossom petal carpets, we would have autumn leaf carpets you can find/place on the floor around trees, and have the little sprites of falling leaves. everything you need is already pretty much implemented in the game. a new mob for it like a squirrel or an owl would be cool but not necessary.

I had the same idea and already wrote out the suggestion so ill post it here:

We know that seasons in minecraft are improbable but I was thinking that there are now biomes in the game that represent each season except for ONE. Plains/Beach = summer. any snow biome = Winter. Cherry Grove = spring. But we dont have any for autumn. So i was thinking what if there was a new biome? maybe called something like Maple Forest. It will have orange leaved trees like the leaves in autumn. There will be a falling leaves particle that spawn under the leaves. I feel like it would be a good idea if there were leaf piles and once you right click or break them you either get loot (maybe a biome exclusive item) or a mob could jump out? It would also be cool if you could make them yourself and hide items in them.

Another thought I had is that this idea could be a good way to introduce a mob like squirrels to minecraft! because I feel like rummaging through leaf piles and finding acorns could be cool and could also be used to tame or breed the squirrels. Like bees with their bee hives, I feel like it could be cool if, in some of the trees, one of the logs has a hole and thats where the squirrels go at night. If you break the log with a hole in it i'd imagine you just get a normal log (and if there are squirrels inside when the log is broken they would get kicked out like bees do) but the player would also be able to craft a man-made home for the squirrels

Shouldn't iron outclass bronze? I like the idea of bronze but I can't see it being any more than just an extra step unfortunately. As much as I'd like to see it as a stepping stone to iron, I don't see that being implemented personally..

This is exactly what I was going to write! Excellent idea, we need more votes... I would rather have Bronze tools and armour then copper because it is more durable. It would look similar to copper but more durable. Copper and waxed copper for blocks; Bronze for tools and armour. It would have higher durability than iron but just slightly less powerful. Personally I think iron should be less easy to find underground and that you should only be able to smelt ores in the blast furnace because in real life you need very high temperatures to smelt most ores.
I don't know man, there really aren't that much uses for Mojang to add 2 new metals at once
I mean, given that you have to mine two ores instead of one, it's probably fair that bronze is better than iron.

Very nice, but if you look back at real history, The Bronze Age came before the Iron Age. Iron is better than Bronze. I had the idea that bronze crafted with a mob head (which would have to changed to be obtainable in survival mode) would create a bronze statue of that mob. Maybe about 2 or 3 blocks tall. And I like the idea that Bronze can be used for some sort of tool, maybe not complete set of tools and armor. But what could be cool, is if they update the villagers again and we get villager soldiers/guards, maybe Bronze Armor can be something that exclusively villagers wear, and they player can gift the armor to them for something in exchange, and that'll be how you trade with soldier villagers.
LizardGizard06 all mob heads except steve are obtainable in survival if a charged creeper explodes the respective mob.

A ideia √© interessante mesmo, porque √© o recurso natural que o cobre tem, j√° que ele n√£o serve para ferramentas, armas e armaduras. O estanho e o cobre geram o bronze e esse sim foi muito importante no desenvolvimento da humanidade, ent√£o seria justo se a Mojang adicionar o estanho.

J√° existe um mod que faz isso, mas infelizmente ele n√£o funciona no bedrock.

Bronze is harder and stronger than Iron.

Iron is cheap. That's why the Iron Age replaced it.

Unless tin has separate reasons to exist, I want Bronze to fix the feature creep, not increase it, so instead copper and iron makes bronze. If it needs a blast furnace, then diamond tools/armor also need to require specialty equipment, otherwise it won't make sense to make it since it'd be faster to just make diamonds.

Bronze would make better tools than iron, it would make instruments, and as one article suggested, custom music discs - with all the same instruments in the OG discs being possible to make. Copper would be used for bronze, and also weak copper tools if you're desperate so it doesn't feel so useless, like how goats do. Copper could also be used for any future redstone implements, maybe electricity for wireless red stone, or a way to make redstone smaller.

Bronze can be used to make springs, which can be used to heal and build golems (which are now a reasonable thing to actually make, I don't know how they'd balance that but nobody ever uses iron golems as far as I know.) Bronze can be used to make submarines and improved boats. Maybe the FTB paxel. Bronze is also now necessary to make lamps, and it can be used to make mirrored glass (for city builds, very useful)

So better tools, musical instruments, music discs, submarines, boats, springs for golems, mirrors.
A pretty cool idea
I knew I wasn't the only one that thought of this, my idea was for a river to lead into a cave that also has a river but I think this one would be easier for mojag
this would be a great way to connect rivers under hills and mountains
Aquifiers are similar to underground rivers.

I can imagine it being scary

They should spane very rare since we don want the cave to be full of those things
Ceileeches should be rare to find, but when you do find them, they spawn in bulk. Kind of like a vane of them.
cool idea. gordon freeman

Yes, I love this idea. Since we can't have cars, this would be a great alternative. These wouldn't be found naturally; you would have to craft them. Maybe you could get one as a reward in a woodland mansion? I think the amount of horses you use on the wagon should vary the speed! For example, if you only have one horse, the wagon can only go at a fair speed, but with two horses they should be able to run and the wagon should be able to go fast if you press some kind of button that shows up on your screen or some kind of key on a keyboard. I personally think three horses is too many.

You could also use the wagon to keep horses tied up while you do something else.

However, I'm a bit worried about this idea. Since Mojang wouldn't include sharks ingame, I'm not sure about horse-drawn wagons because using horses to pull a cart is labour, and I don't know if they'd want to encourage kids this. But I'm hoping this idea will be fine since you can already ride horses.

Only this needs to be CAREFULLY implemented. The horses and the wagon must be separate physical objects. Otherwise, this structure will levitate in an ugly way at the edge of the blocks. Also, it is not clear what the wheels will look like. Pixel round sprite or "square" 3D model? I believe that the closed wheel arches will be an elegant and aesthetic solution.So that the wheels are completely invisible.
I say it should be able to have blocks placed on it like chest for storage

Please!

this would be so nice!

(and would make a lot of sense)

Yes!
It would be super useful, especially for automatic farms

We need this!!
Please!!!!
I hope they add this to java and bedrock.

I thought this feature already existed, so clearly it would make sense if it were added. Instead, I just burned an iron bucket in a lava cauldron thinking "this functionality exists in other places, it should exist here."
It would be nice if not only buckets but also dyes could be functionallity by dispenser.
We need that!

Now this would be horrifying in the new caves, imagine you're caving and in a massive cave and you hear a spider hiss, look up, and it's falling towards you.

I would like to see spiders climb walls sideways like the picture shows instead of just looking like they're floating right now, but they shouldn't be able to climb ceilings too, they would be too annoying to get keep them away, like when you're building up or something.

Yes, please. The caves and cliffs update promo picture thing even shows spiders climbing on walls and stuff with their models turned accordingly. Though, if they climbed on ceilings, it might break some people's spider-proof walls?

Also, perhaps they could have some kind of web attack similar to the spiders in Minecraft Dungeons? Maybe it could use a mechanic like the ice generated from frostwalker boots where the webs would degrade over a few seconds.

I like the story of this soft-lore update. Perhaps the ocean monument & woodlands mansion could be refurbished with the prismarine slabs/stairs & copper slabs/stairs. Along with some variants on the puzzle in the jungle temple, and a puzzle for the desert temple which could utilize target blocks or buttons.

For update 1.19 (after caves and cliffs part 2) It could be decoration and furniture because when ever i'm building I have a lot of strugles with furniture and I'm sure a lot of other players would be happy with it to

And maybe make craftable armor and tools with "Amethist(don't know how to spell) and Copper"  which would be useful like the netherite in 1.16 sorry if its much but those are my recommended things and maybe glow armor because that sounds nice

We  could just make it so its more visible in the dark rather than emitting light. Can you imagine a glowing _Jeb. Also speaking on this topic adding glow ink to different colored wool to make it more visible in the dark.

Apparently it was intentional that it appears orange but I still don't really get why

The problem with that is there to similar to redstone and lapis,  One important thing is your ability to immediately recognize what kind of ore you found, The reasons I think they did the texture change. Although I‚Äôve always been a big fan of Rubys and sapphires and I used to really want them in the game I realize that this kind of makes them difficult to implement.
I think this would be a bit overpowered as people would create mods that would take advantage of this. It is a great idea, though!
chance for dimonds in the center of the vein encouraging players to mine coal
Or better yet a coal ore could have a small chance of dropping one diamond

I think this is too overpowered, and here's why.

Coal ore generates in MASSIVE veins deep underground, nearing 30 ores/vein sometimes. 3/200 (1.5%) x 30 = 9/20, which is almost 50%. That means that a diamond ore will try to replace coal ore around 50% of the time in every single ore vein. Assuming there's around 5-10 coal ore veins per chunk, that means that there will be an additional 3-5 diamond ore blocks in every single chunk. The replace percentage needs to be much lower, probably around 0.1 or 0.15% of the time, keeping this a fun surprise.
Only if the plants regrow, otherwise you have a griefer mob.
Bro, I just remembered now: aren't goats the animals that just freeze like a statue when scared (the smol ones, I think)?
This works but only if you lower the rate of which it eats a lot or else we have enderman but worse.

Very cool idea. It could also give you 1-2 extra hearts temporarely like the golden apple and maybe the potion increased duration should be 30 sec instead.

This is a really good idea! Make the returns diminishing and it's balanced. (If you get an effect, say, regeneration, each time you drink goat milk adds less time until you run out, then next time you get regeneration it resets)

Perhaps upon being attacked the goat would either run away quickly or maneuver around the mob while preparing for another charge. In order to charge they may loop around and gain some distance in order to charge again. If they charge into a shield there is a chance of their horns getting knocked off.

I think if you hit the goat when you‚Äôre right next to it, it should do an instant attack with slight knockback. Then, if you hit it again, it will do this attack again, but follow up with a charge.

However, if your first attack does enough damage (like if you‚Äôre using a sword), it should do the small attack and follow with a charge without waiting for you to attack it again.
to make this more useful they could also scare away iron golems and piglins.
I really like this idea. It fits into the Minecraft lore, solves an age-old problem and gives the goat horn a purpose all in one.
it should also scare wandering traders, which right now are a major pain to deal with and don't despawn for years. These days most people kill them which I think is sad
Going back to my previous comment I think that goat horns could scare away the new warden mob.  this would be because it would hurt their ears.
this sounds interesting tho. butthe problem is.... why are u standing there, just vote this!
Great idea! But I wouldn't use the Jungle Villager texture since in my opinion it isn't lush enough. It should either be more green-ish or like a glowberry a bit more colorful.
